integrator_utils.cc

1 #include "voxblox/integrator/integrator_utils.h"
2 
3 namespace voxblox {
4 
5 // Small class that can be used by multiple threads that need mutually exclusive
6 // indexes to the same array, while still covering all elements.
7 // The class attempts to ensure that the points are read in an order that gives
8 // good coverage over the pointcloud very quickly. This is so that the
9 // integrator can be terminated before all points have been read (due to time
10 // constraints) and still capture most of the geometry.
11 ThreadSafeIndex::ThreadSafeIndex(size_t number_of_points)
12  : atomic_idx_(0),
13  number_of_points_(number_of_points),
14  number_of_groups_(number_of_points / step_size_) {}
15 
16 // returns true if index is valid, false otherwise
17 bool ThreadSafeIndex::getNextIndex(size_t* idx) {
18  DCHECK(idx != nullptr);
19  size_t sequential_idx = atomic_idx_.fetch_add(1);
20 
21  if (sequential_idx >= number_of_points_) {
22  return false;
23  } else {
24  *idx = getMixedIndex(sequential_idx);
25  return true;
26  }
27 }
28 
29 void ThreadSafeIndex::reset() { atomic_idx_.store(0); }
30 
31 size_t ThreadSafeIndex::getMixedIndex(size_t base_idx) {
32  if (number_of_groups_ * step_size_ <= base_idx) {
33  return base_idx;
34  }
35 
36  const size_t group_num = base_idx % number_of_groups_;
37  const size_t position_in_group = base_idx / number_of_groups_;
38 
39  return group_num * step_size_ + position_in_group;
40 }
41

44 // bits reversed.

135 
136 // This class assumes PRE-SCALED coordinates, where one unit = one voxel size.
137 // The indices are also returned in this scales coordinate system, which should
138 // map to voxel indices.
139 RayCaster::RayCaster(const Point& origin, const Point& point_G,
140  const bool is_clearing_ray,
141  const bool voxel_carving_enabled,
142  const FloatingPoint max_ray_length_m,
143  const FloatingPoint voxel_size_inv,
144  const FloatingPoint truncation_distance,
145  const bool cast_from_origin) {
146  const Ray unit_ray = (point_G - origin).normalized();
147 
148  Point ray_start, ray_end;
149  if (is_clearing_ray) {
150  FloatingPoint ray_length = (point_G - origin).norm();
151  ray_length = std::min(std::max(ray_length - truncation_distance,
152  static_cast<FloatingPoint>(0.0)),
153  max_ray_length_m);
154  ray_end = origin + unit_ray * ray_length;
155  ray_start = voxel_carving_enabled ? origin : ray_end;
156  } else {
157  ray_end = point_G + unit_ray * truncation_distance;
158  ray_start = voxel_carving_enabled
159  ? origin
160  : (point_G - unit_ray * truncation_distance);
161  }
162 
163  const Point start_scaled = ray_start * voxel_size_inv;
164  const Point end_scaled = ray_end * voxel_size_inv;
165 
166  if (cast_from_origin) {
167  setupRayCaster(start_scaled, end_scaled);
168  } else {
169  setupRayCaster(end_scaled, start_scaled);
170  }
171 }
172 
173 RayCaster::RayCaster(const Point& start_scaled, const Point& end_scaled) {
174  setupRayCaster(start_scaled, end_scaled);
175 }
176 
177 // returns false if ray terminates at ray_index, true otherwise
178 bool RayCaster::nextRayIndex(GlobalIndex* ray_index) {
179  if (current_step_++ > ray_length_in_steps_) {
180  return false;
181  }
182 
183  DCHECK(ray_index != nullptr);
184  *ray_index = curr_index_;
185 
186  int t_min_idx;
187  t_to_next_boundary_.minCoeff(&t_min_idx);
188  curr_index_[t_min_idx] += ray_step_signs_[t_min_idx];
189  t_to_next_boundary_[t_min_idx] += t_step_size_[t_min_idx];
190 
191  return true;
192 }
193 
194 void RayCaster::setupRayCaster(const Point& start_scaled,
195  const Point& end_scaled) {
196  if (start_scaled.array().isNaN().any() || end_scaled.array().isNaN().any()) {
197  ray_length_in_steps_ = 0;
198  return;
199  }
200 
201  curr_index_ = getGridIndexFromPoint<GlobalIndex>(start_scaled);
202  const GlobalIndex end_index = getGridIndexFromPoint<GlobalIndex>(end_scaled);
203  const GlobalIndex diff_index = end_index - curr_index_;
204 
205  current_step_ = 0;
206 
207  ray_length_in_steps_ = std::abs(diff_index.x()) + std::abs(diff_index.y()) +
208  std::abs(diff_index.z());
209 
210  const Ray ray_scaled = end_scaled - start_scaled;
211 
212  ray_step_signs_ = AnyIndex(signum(ray_scaled.x()), signum(ray_scaled.y()),
213  signum(ray_scaled.z()));
214 
215  const AnyIndex corrected_step(std::max(0, ray_step_signs_.x()),
216  std::max(0, ray_step_signs_.y()),
217  std::max(0, ray_step_signs_.z()));
218 
219  const Point start_scaled_shifted =
220  start_scaled - curr_index_.cast<FloatingPoint>();
221 
222  Ray distance_to_boundaries(corrected_step.cast<FloatingPoint>() -
223  start_scaled_shifted);
224 
225  t_to_next_boundary_ =
226  Ray((std::abs(ray_scaled.x()) < 0.0) ? 2.0 : distance_to_boundaries.x() /
227  ray_scaled.x(),
228  (std::abs(ray_scaled.y()) < 0.0) ? 2.0 : distance_to_boundaries.y() /
229  ray_scaled.y(),
230  (std::abs(ray_scaled.z()) < 0.0) ? 2.0 : distance_to_boundaries.z() /
231  ray_scaled.z());
232 
233  // Distance to cross one grid cell along the ray in t.
234  // Same as absolute inverse value of delta_coord.
235  t_step_size_ = Ray(
236  (std::abs(ray_scaled.x()) < 0.0) ? 2.0
237  : ray_step_signs_.x() / ray_scaled.x(),
238  (std::abs(ray_scaled.y()) < 0.0) ? 2.0
239  : ray_step_signs_.y() / ray_scaled.y(),
240  (std::abs(ray_scaled.z()) < 0.0) ? 2.0
241  : ray_step_signs_.z() / ray_scaled.z());
242 }
243
